properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 2:34AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
Doppler radar indicated freezing drizzle was developing across
portions of west-central Illinois. The freezing drizzle was
expanding into Knox county, and may eventually reach Stark and
Marshall counties. The potential for freezing drizzle will
continue through 6 or 7 am, after which temperatures are expected
to climb above freezing.

With temperatures currently hovering around freezing, the
freezing drizzle may create a glaze of ice on untreated roads and
sidewalks. Hazardous travel may develop for the morning commute,
especially on bridges and overpasses.

Temperatures warming even before sunrise should limit the
duration of any icy conditions, but remain alert for slippery
roads early this morning.
